Vous avez quelques-unes de ces compétences, postulez !

Title: Administrateur Big Data – Conception Développement Big Data
Description: Emploi  Be Free Talent, le connecteur de talents 2.0 Vous êtes en charge du fonctionnement et de l’exploitation de plusieurs logiciels Big Data ( Oozie, Kafka, Nifi, Ambar…) de votre structure. Vous définissez et accompagnez une équipe sur l’élaboration d’un service Big Data (gestion d’incidents, installation, livraison, conception…) Par ailleurs, si vous êtes autonome, curieux, alors, cette offre d’emploi vous correspondra. Venez et laissez parler votre talent ! Diplômé d’un master ou mastère spécialisé en informatique, vous avez plusieurs années d’expériences professionnelles à votre actif dans le domaine du Big Data ou développement web. Alors, cette offre d’emploi est susceptible de vous correspondre.

Title: Data Scientist Intern
Description: BlaBlaCar’s vision is to bring fairness, freedom and fraternity to the world of travel. BlaBlaCar was created in 2006 with one dream in mind: fill the millions of empty seats on the road to create an efficient, affordable and friendly way to travel. Today, our global, trusted community counts 75 million members in 22 countries, enabling a smarter, large scale and truly sustainable transport network. Born from a simple idea of people sharing their rides, BlaBlaCar’s ambition is to become the go-to marketplace for shared road mobility. We offer long distance carpooling service, a commuting carpooling service, and since 2018 a marketplace bus service too. A filled bus emits one third of the emissions per passenger kilometer as an average car. So we want to fill those seats too! In 2018, 84 million travellers used BlaBlaCar globally saving 1.6 million tons of CO2. Meanwhile we enabled human connections, bringing people closer together in more ways than one with 87% of members say that carpooling is an enriching experience. BlaBlaCar offers a truly and unique international environment with a team counting 35 nationalities, serving a global member-base from 8 offices in Berlin, Kiev, Madrid, Milan, Moscow, Paris (HQ), São Paulo, Warsaw. English is the official spoken language across BlaBlaCar. We are privately-held and founder-led. Our team of 500 employees is entrepreneurial, passionate, and fundamentally mission-driven. One of BlaBlaCar’s key strategic goals is to leverage data through Machine Learning in order to trigger growth opportunities. Data Science has been instrumental to successfully launching new services for the past two years, yet the potential for improvements is still massive. If you are looking for exciting challenges, impacting millions of users and working on a state-of-the-art cloud platform, come and join us! What you will contribute to : Modelizing the user behavior to predict the probability of each person to book a trip Analyzing the factors that help users to convert and help adapt the bids on the search engine marketing platforms Working with software engineers and other data scientists to implement real-time solutions to maximize millions of users’ chances of travelling with BlaBlaCar. Preferred Experience What you will need to be successful: Engineering school, PhD or Master degree in Math, Stats, OR, ML, Engineering. Having taken courses in Statistics & Machine learning Proficiency in Python or R Knowledge of ML frameworks (eg Tensorflow, Keras, Scikit, Xgboost) Autonomous, detail-oriented Enjoy working as a team-player and learning from others Fluent in English (French is not mandatory) A few practical details about the role : Start: As soon as you are ready! Location: Paris HQ Contract: 6 months-Internship - possible to lead to a full time contract What we offer all of our employees: A start-up spirit that fosters agility, teamwork and impact Challenging career opportunities in a high-growth and fast-paced environment An inspiring working environment including state-of-the-art office spaces Free carpooling to live our value “Be The Member” Annual BlaBlaBreak which takes us all for an unforgettable weekend Bi-Weekly BlaBlaTalks when we learn from each other Weekly Tech Demos Recruitment Process What is next: If you are ready to join our exciting journey, please apply below: upload your resume in English (PDF format) and answer our questions in English. Kindly note that only complete applications will be reviewed by our hiring team and that all your information will be kept confidential. You can expect us to review your application within the following 2 weeks. If your application fits our requirements, we will invite you to a first call followed by two interviews with analytical tests and case study. BlaBlaCar is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Additional Information Contract Type: Internship (Between 6 and 6 months) Start Date: 22 September 2019 Location: Paris, France () Education Level: Master's Degree Experience: < 6 months

Title: Data Engineer Manager
Description: BlaBlaCar’s vision is to bring fairness, freedom and fraternity to the world of travel. BlaBlaCar was created in 2006 with one dream in mind: fill the millions of empty seats on the road to create an efficient, affordable and friendly way to travel. Today, our global, trusted community counts 75 million members in 22 countries, enabling a smarter, large scale and truly sustainable transport network. Born from a simple idea of people sharing their rides, BlaBlaCar’s ambition is to become the go-to marketplace for shared road mobility. We offer long distance carpooling service, a commuting carpooling service, and since 2018 a marketplace bus service too. A filled bus emits one third of the emissions per passenger kilometer as an average car. So we want to fill those seats too! In 2018, 84 million travellers used BlaBlaCar globally saving 1.6 million tons of CO2. Meanwhile we enabled human connections, bringing people closer together in more ways than one with 87% of members say that carpooling is an enriching experience. BlaBlaCar offers a truly and unique international environment with a team counting 35 nationalities, serving a global member-base from 8 offices in Berlin, Kiev, Madrid, Milan, Moscow, Paris (HQ), São Paulo, Warsaw. English is the official spoken language across BlaBlaCar. We are privately-held and founder-led. Our team of 500 employees is entrepreneurial, passionate, and fundamentally mission-driven. Job Description Why join us ? The warehouse team sits within the data team, in the engineering organization. The data team mission is to supply dependable data and algorithms to BlaBla employees and products. The warehouse team mission is to supply dependable data to the company. Dependable means trustworthy and reliable: stakeholders need to be 100% confident their data is accurate, and this data is delivered in a timely and predictable fashion, to whoever needs it. BlaBlaCar is a data-driven company: from top-management to junior contributors, everyone understands and believes in the value data brings. Supplying data to the company puts the warehouse team at the center of critical decision-making processes, ranging from strategic planning to product analytics, through financial reporting and marketing performance monitoring. The scope covered by the team is wide; accordingly, the warehouse manager role has tremendous impact on the activity. The warehouse manager mission is to make supplying dependable data possible. The challenge can be broken down into the following goals: Manage the team and setting it up for success; Communication and stakeholder management; Building a vision to provide data as a service. What you will contribute to : Managing the team and setting it up for success Hiring and onboarding newcomers. The team is expected to scale up as operations are ramping up; Building new expertise within the team, around real-time data processing. This will go through training existing members and hiring experienced data engineers; Taking responsibility for implementing best practices and ensure the team has best in class processes. This is critical to maximize the productivity of the team and mitigate operational risks; Structuring the team to scale further in 2020. This includes clarifying roles and responsibilities within the team. Communication and stakeholder management Handling communication for the team vis-a-vis the rest of the company. The focus is on structuring the vision for the team to the outside world; Communicating sideways and upwards about roadmap progress, organizational changes & dependencies. Communicating downstream to update the team on company’s context, strategy and articulate their impact for the team; Creating close ties with stakeholders in Marketing, Finance, Product and Engineering organizations. This is critical to ensure information flows enable the team to prioritize its work. Building a vision to provide data as a service Defining a vision and objectives for the team to come up with its roadmap. Communicating with stakeholders to align on strategic priorities. In particular, this means balancing multi-year plans with short-term deliverables (e.g. stream processing for ML); Steering the team towards delivering data-as-a service. This includes anticipating use-cases with high business impact, and pave the way to deliver solution enabling them; Deploying accountability frameworks to measure efficiency and improve it. This is crucial to legitimate the significant amount of resources invested in data engineering projects; Managing third-party resources to strike the right balance between in-house and external expertise. This includes all steps of the budgeting process. Preferred Experience What you will need to be successful: +5 years of leadership experience with demonstrated growth of high-functioning data engineering teams Strong project management, organizational and communication skills Strong data standards Experience working in a fast paced, highly collaborative environment Excellent English communication skills Ensure a good mindset and keep a good culture in your team Be high-energy, humble, structured, organized, motivated by innovation and a relentless doer and leader A few practical details about the role : Start: As soon as you are ready! Location: Paris HQ (remote friendly) Contract: Full-time permanent contract (CDI) Compensation: Competitive package based on experience What we offer all of our employees: A start-up spirit that fosters agility, teamwork and impact Challenging career opportunities in a high-growth and fast-paced environment An inspiring working environment including state-of-the-art office spaces Free carpooling to live our value “Be The Member” Annual BlaBlaBreak which takes us all for an unforgettable weekend Bi-Weekly BlaBlaTalks when we learn from each other Weekly Tech Demos Recruitment Process What is next: If you are ready to join our exciting journey, please apply below: upload your resume in English (PDF format) and your cover letter. Applications without cover letter will not be considered. Kindly note that only complete applications will be reviewed by our hiring team and that all your information will be kept confidential. You can expect us to review your application within the following 2 weeks. If your application fits our requirements, we will invite you to a first call followed by several face-to-face interviews and a case study. BlaBlaCar is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Additional Information Contract Type: Full-Time Start Date: 24 November 2019 Location: Paris, France () Experience: > 7 years

Title: data scientist avec dev python / R et bon anglais / Freelance
Description: Le/La data scientist.e : développe le code relatif à des algorithmes en vue de leur mise en production, en travaillant au préalable sur un code design pertinent ; contribue au développement de la solution de maintenance prédictive portée par l’équipe ; développe / maintient le code sous-jacent au framework d’industrialisation d’algorithmes ; est l’un des garants de la qualité du code (tests unitaires, tests de non-régression, standards de développement ) ; livre le code attendu dans le respect des délais parfois contraints, cadencés par les releases trimestrielles de la solution s’implique dans la maintenance et l’amélioration des packages existants ; s’inscrit dans les rituels de l’équipe et fait des suggestions pour améliorer les processus ; contribue à la veille scientifique et technique de l’équipe ; est force de proposition pour des idées de nouveaux cas d’usage ; fait remonter d’éventuelles anomalies identifiées dans la qualité des données. Python: Confirmé Git/Github: Confirmé Programmation orientée objet et fonctionnelle: Confirmé R: Confirmé Docker: Confirmé Azure: Confirmé PowerBI: Confirmé SQL: Confirmé Algorithmes standard d’apprentissage automatique: Confirmé Séries temporelles: Confirmé Statistique mathématique: Confirmé

Title: Manager Data Application Engineer
Description: Who are we ? ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we're enjoying skyrocketing growth. ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients' specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we've acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe. ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.  To support and develop its growth, Artefact is looking for the up and coming talents in the data division to oversee the engineering team. Organized in feature team, you will work in project mode (or pizza team) to advise your clients on their IA problematics, machine learning and Big Data. The scope of your projects can run from the migration of infrastructure to the Cloud (Deezer) to the construction of a predictive model for rising sea levels (Greenpeace). ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  Your assignments : Management : You work within a team where mutual aid and development of competences are key, you coach interns and juniors, you carry out technological monitoring, you take part in technical training given by our partners such as Google or Azure. ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  Delivery: You are full owner of the front to back solution, responsible for devising, implementing and deploying it. You work within a team made up of engineers, consultants, data scientists, strategic planners to identify your client needs and define innovative solutions.  Project: You are a key actor to company success participating in pitches and securing deals. Your technical capacities will allow you forge ties with your clients while accompanying and guiding them in their data and digital transformation. You will contribute to making Artefact an essential business partner.  Consulting: You are adept at choosing and setting up the most suitable technical stack based on your client's needs. You have a critical mindset to understand and optimize the organisational functioning of large firms.  Your mindset ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  Curious, you are always on the lookout for the latest solutions to best meet client needs. You're actively involved in the entire value chain, whether it be front-end, back end, big data infrastructure, ML model… ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  Entrepreneurial spirit, you come up with solutions, new ideas not only within your team but also within the entire Artefact world  Benevolent, your team fulfillment is key for you, thanks to constructive feedback you guide,drive and make your collaborators grow ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  Advocate of knowledge sharing, you actively participate in circulating information within Artefact (seminars, trainings, certifications, online KM)  ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  Profile: Ideally you hold a masters in Software Engineering or possibly machine Learning, mathematics, or computer science  Minimum three years of experience developing and implementing data driven solutions within a consulting firm  You have the capacity to actively participate in all the project value chain ( building infrastructure and platforms, collecting data, machine learning application models, setting up API's REST, tests and continuous deployment)  You have in-depth knowledge of Python, you have a strong interest for DevOps, you're familiar with Cloud technologies such as GCP or Azure. You master data technologies like Spark or Beam, with previous experience of Docker (Kubernetes is a plus)  You're a ninja of the use and exploitation of data bus like Kafka or PubSub  You have practiced indexation system such as ElasticSearch and Vespa. Ideally, you have implementation experience of a LETOR  You have a proven capacity to vulgarize technical terms and solutions for those coming from the business field, you are a key player in a diverse team  You can foresee projects risks and mitigate them through your technological choices  You have a working command of business English  Why us ?  Cutting edge stack : Python,Kubernetes, Spinnaker, Kafka, Spark, Google Cloud Platform (BQ, Dataflow, Compute Engine, PubSub, AppEngine…) , Airflow, Docker  Wide variety of projects : Datalake set up Chatbot building Industrialisation of machine learning algorithms Define the data strategy Young and challenging environment of skilled engineers , grow your skills thanks to our mentoring program  Internationally renowned : offices in Dubaï, London, Hong Kong, Sao Paulo  Come join us #FR !  Talents-fr@artefact.com ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )  ( Talents-fr@artefact.com )
